name: src/gisValidators.js
precision
description: For **Location** object - checks whether a value is more precise than `validValue`
examples:
precision(10)({ accuracy: 4 }) => true
precision(10)({ accuracy: 12 }) => false
precision(10)({ coords: { accuracy: 4 }}) => true
precision(10)({ coords: { accuracy: 12 }}) => false

name: maxDistance
description: For **Coordinates** - distance between `p1` and `p2` is less than or equal to `validValue`

name: codeInDomain
description:
For **Number, String** - checks whether a value is present in `validValue` domain members.
This will check only `code` property, you can use `valueInDomain()` to search for values.

name: valueInDomain
description:
For **Number, String** - checks whether a value is present in `validValue` domain members.
This will check `name` (used by ESRI domains) or `value` property, you can use `codeInDomain()` to search for codes.

name: src/index.js

properties.name: validate
properties.description: validator function which takes values and validates them

properties.name: name
properties.description: name of the validator - should be unique

name: getValidator
description: Get a validator function
examples:
getValidator({ name: 'required' }) => `required` validator
getValidator({ name: 'precision', validValue: 4 }) => `precision` validator with accuracy 4 meters
getValidator({ name: 'between', validValue: [1, 4] }) => `between` validator with valid range [1, 4]
getValidator({ name: 'maxDistance' validValue: 100 }) => `maxDistance` validator with maxumum distance 100 meters

throws.description: when there is no validation function defined

name: addValidator
description: Add a new validator.
examples: addValidator({ name: "exact", validValue: 1, validate: (value) => value === 1 }) => defines and returns a new validator with name `exact`

name: src/math.js
toDegrees
description: Convert a value from radians to degrees.

name: toRadians
description: Conver a value from degrees to radians.

name: getDistance
description: Calculates the Eucledian distance between two points.

name: metersToDegrees
description: Convert distance from meters to decimal degrees

params.name: latitude
params.description: current latitude, default is 0 - the equator

name: degreesToMeters
description: Convert distance from decimal degrees to meters

params.name: latitude
params.description: latitude of the reference parallel, default is 0 - the equator

name: src/validators.js
isDefined
description: Checks whether a value is defined or not
examples:
isDefined()(4) => true
isDefined()(null) => false
isDefined()('') => false

name: min
description: For **Array**, **String** - checks whether value's length is greater than or equal to `validValue`
examples:
min(3)('as') => false
min(3)('asd') => true
min(3)('asdf') => true

name: max
description: For **Array**, **String** - checks whether value's length is greater than or equal to `validValue`
examples:
max(3)('as') => true
max(3)('asd') => true
max(3)('asdf') => false

name: contain
description: For **Array**, **String** - checks whether a value contains `validValue`
examples:
contain('test')('testA') => true
contain('test')('B test') => true
contain('test')([1, 'test'])) => true
contain('test')('asd') => false

name: notContain
description: For **Array**, **String** - checks whether a value deos not contain `validValue`
examples:
notContain('test'))('testA') => false
notContain('test'))('B test') => false
notContain('test')([1, 'test'])) => false
notContain('test'))('asd') => true

name: like
description: For **String** - checks whether a value is equal to `validValue`
examples:
like('test')('test') => true
like('test')('Test') => false
like('test')('asdasd') => false

name: notLike
description: For **String** - checks whether a value is not equal to `validValue`
examples:
notLike('test')('asd') => true
notLike('test')('Test') => true
notLike('test')('test') => false

name: equal
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is equal to `validValue`
examples:
equal(2)(2) => true
equal(2)(22) => false
equal('test')('test') => false

name: notEqual
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is not equal to `validValue`
examples:
notEqual(1)(2) => true
notEqual(1)(1) => false
notEqual('test')('test') => true
notEqual('test')('asdd') => true

name: between
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is in the range of `validValue`
examples:
between([1, 4])(1) => true
between([1, 4])(4) => true
between([1, 4])(6) => false

name: notBetween
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is not in the range of `validValue`
examples:
notBetween([1, 4])(1) => false
notBetween([1, 4])(2) => false
notBetween([1, 4])(4) => false
notBetween([1, 4])(6) => true

name: inValues
description: For **Number, String** - checks whether a value is in `validValue` array
examples:
inValues([1, 2, 3])(1) => true
inValues([1, 2, 3])(2) => true
inValues([1, 2, 3])(3) => true
inValues([1, 2, 3])(4) => false

name: notInValues
description: For **Number, String** - checks whether a value is not in `validValue` array
examples:
notInValues([1, 2, 3])(4) => true
notInValues([1, 2, 3])(3) => false
notInValues([1, 2, 3])(2) => false
notInValues([1, 2, 3])(1) => false

name: greaterThan
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is greater than `validValue`
examples:
greaterThan(2)(12) => true
greaterThan(2)(2) => false
greaterThan(2)(1) => false

name: greaterThanOrEqual
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is greater than or equal to `validValue`
examples:
greaterThanOrEqual(2)(2) => true
greaterThanOrEqual(2)(12) => true
greaterThanOrEqual(2)(1) => false

name: lessThan
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is less than `validValue`
examples:
lessThan(2)(1) => true
lessThan(2)(0) => true
lessThan(2)(2) => false

name: lessThanOrEqual
description: For **Number** - checks whether a value is less than or equal to `validValue`
examples:
lessThanOrEqual(2)(2) => true
lessThanOrEqual(2)(1) => true
lessThanOrEqual(2)(22) => false

name: isString
description: For **Any** - checks whether a value is from type `string`
examples:
isString()('test') => true
isString()('2') => true
isString()('false') => true
isString()(false) => false
isString()(1) => false
isString()() => false

name: isArray
description: For **Any** - checks whether a value is an `array`
examples:
isArray()([]) => true
isArray()(['2']) => true
isArray()(false) => false
isArray()(1) => false
isArray()({}) => false
isArray()() => false

name: isNumber
description: For **Any** - checks whether a value is from type `number`
examples:
isNumber()(1) => true
isNumber()(-1) => true
isNumber()('1') => false
isNumber()() => false
isNumber()({}) => false
isNumber()(false) => false

name: isInteger
description: For **Any** - checks whether a value is an integer `number`
examples:
isInteger()(1) => true
isInteger()(-1) => true
isInteger()(-2.3) => false
isInteger()(3.1415926536) => false
isInteger()({}) => false
isInteger()(false) => false

name: isBoolean
description: For **Any** - checks whether a value is from type `boolean`
examples:
isBoolean()(true) => true
isBoolean()(false) => true
isBoolean()('true') => false
isBoolean()() => false

name: isFunction
description: For **Any** - checks whether a value is `function`
examples:
isFunction()(a => a * a) => true
isFunction()(true) => false
isFunction()({}) => false

content:
# Validators

Set of custom validation functions. You can read the documentation here: [https://bojko108.github.io/validators/](https://bojko108.github.io/validators/)

## How to install

```
yarn add bojko108/validators
```

## How to use

### Get a validator

```js
import { getValidator } from 'validators';

const validator1 = getValidator({ name: 'precision' validValue: 10 });
validator1.validate({ coords: { accuracy: 4 } }); // => true

const validator2 = getValidator({ name: 'between', validValue: [1, 4] });
validator2.validate(1); // => true
```

### Add a custom validator

```js
import { addValidator } from 'validators';

const validator = addValidator({
  name: 'exact',
  validValue: 1,
  validate: value => {
    return value === validValue;
  }
});
validator.validate(value);
```

## Validators

Here is a list of all predefined validators. You can use them by calling `getValidator({ name: <validatorName> })`. All custom validators added by `addValidator()` will be available in `getValidator()`. An error is thrown if a validator already exists and you try to redefine it with `addValidator()`.

### Validators

- `isDefined` - returns `true` if the value is defined. Returns `false` for `undefined` and `null`.
- `isString` - returns `true` if the value is `string`.
- `isArray` - returns `true` if the value type is `array`.
- `isNumber` - returns `true` if the value type is `number`.
- `isInteger` - returns `true` if the value is an integer `number`.
- `isBoolean` - returns `true` if the value type is `boolean`.
- `isFunction` - returns `true` if the value type is `function`.
- `min` - validates length of **Array** or **String**. Returns `true` if the length is greater than or equal to the valid value.
- `max` - validates length of **Array** or **String**. Returns `true` if the length is less than or equal to the valid value.
- `contain` - validates **Array** or **String**. Returns `true` if the valid value contains tested value. Opposite of `notContain`.
- `notContain` - validates **Array** or **String**. Returns `true` if the valid value does not contain tested value. Opposite of `contain`.
- `like` - validates **String**. Returns `true` if the tested value is equal to the valid value. Opposite of `notLike`.
- `notLike` - validates **String**. Returns `true` if the tested value is not equal to the valid value. Opposite of `like`.
- `equal` - validates **Number**. Returns `true` if the tested value is equal to the valid value. Opposite of `notEqual`.
- `notEqual` - validates **String**. Returns `true` if the tested value is not equal to the valid value. Opposite of `equal`.
- `between` - validates **Number**. Returns `true` if the tested value is in the range of the valid value. Opposite of `notBetween`.
- `notBetween` - validates strings. Returns `true` if the tested value is not in the range of the valid value. Opposite of `between`.
- `inValues` - validates **Number** or **String**. Returns `true` if the tested value is present in valid value array. Opposite of `notInValues`.
- `notInValues` - validates **Number** or **String**. Returns `true` if the tested value is not present in valid value array. Opposite of `inValues`.
- `greaterThan` - validates **Number**. Returns `true` if the tested value is greater than the valid value. Opposite of `lessThan`.
- `greaterThanOrEqual` - validates **Number**. Returns `true` if the tested value is greater than or equal to the valid value.
- `lessThan` - validates **Number**. Returns `true` if the tested value is less than the valid value. Opposite of `greaterThan`.
- `lessThanOrEqual` - validates **Number**. Returns `true` if the tested value is less than or equal to the valid value.

### Gis Validators

- `precision` - validates the accuracy of a [Location](https://docs.expo.io/versions/latest/sdk/location/#type-location) object.
- `maxDistance` - calculates distance between two points and returns `true` if it's less than or equal to the valid value. The distance is calculated using eucledian formula. If you use geographic coordinates, you can pass a third parameter to tell the function that the distance should be calculated in meters instead of decimal degrees:

```js
import { maxDistance } from 'validators/src/gisValidators.js';

const validValue = 100; // in meters
const p1 = [42.678748, 23.338703]; // in decimal degrees
const p2 = [42.678803, 23.338928]; // in decimal degrees

// pass true so the distance can be calculated in meters before compared to the valid value
maxDistance(validValue)(p1, p2, true);
```

- `codeInDomain` - validates **Number** or **String**. Returns `true` if the tested value is present in the domain as a value.
- `valueInDomain` - validates **Number** or **String**. Returns `true` if the tested value is present in the domain as a code.

## Tests

Check [tests](https://github.com/bojko108/validators/tree/master/tests) for more examples.

## License

transformations is [MIT](https://github.com/bojko108/validators/tree/master/LICENSE) License @ bojko108
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "validators",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Set of custom validation functions.",
  "author": "bojko108 <bojko108@gmail.com>",
  "license": "MIT",
  "main": "./src/index.js",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/bojko108/validators.git"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "test": "mocha --watch --require babel-core/register ./tests/**/*.test.js",
    "test:nowatch": "mocha --require babel-core/register ./tests/**/*.test.js",
    "docs": "esdoc -c ./.esdoc.json",
    "build": "yarn test:nowatch && yarn docs",
    "patch": "yarn build && npm version patch --no-git-tag-version",
    "minor": "yarn build && npm version minor --no-git-tag-version",
    "major": "yarn build && npm version major --no-git-tag-version"
  },
  "dependencies": {},
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel": "^6.23.0",
    "babel-core": "^6.26.3",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.24.1",
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-lint-plugin": "^1.0.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "mocha": "^5.2.0"
  }
}
name: package.json
